result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:09 AM Defendant Daniel T Patterson in court with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has received discovery.
Defense requests time to review discovery.
Defendant should be finished with program by October. 
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date in November.
Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

11:13 AM Defendant Daniel T Patterson in court with attorneys Craig Michael Kuhary and Roger Pyzyk.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called to address Motion to remove GPS monitoring filed by Atty Kuhary in 21CF1926.
This case tagsalong.
The next hearing already scheduled will remain.
Hearing on May 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on May 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on June 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

08:35 AM Defendant Daniel T Patterson in court with attorneys Craig Michael Kuhary and Roger Pyzyk.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Daniel T Patterson appeared by video means with Attorneys.
Case called for status in 21CF1926 and 22CF182.
Atty Kuhary has filed for discovery in 21CF1926.
Atty Pyzyk has received some discovery in 22CF182.
Defendant is in treatment. 
  Hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
WCS Court Update Report.
Letter from Attorney Pyzyk requesting that defendant appear via Zoom at hearing on 4/29/2022.
Hearing on April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel T Patterson
Current: 2966 N Cramer St., c/o Roots Recovery Houses, Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States  (Effective: 04-08-2022)
Prior: 3267 N. 88th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53222 United States
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:24 AM Defendant Daniel T Patterson in court with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Laboratory report filed by the State.

09:45 AM Attorney Roger C. Pyzyk in court.   Defendant Daniel T Patterson did not appear.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Pyzyk states that the Defendant is in treatment and has another case set for prelim on April 08, 2022 at 09:15 AM.  
The State does not object to adjourning the matter.
The Court will tag this case along with the other matter for prelim hearing.
Attorney Pyzyk states he will be waiving the prelim on this case.
Preliminary time limits previously waived.
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2022 at 09:05 am.

Daniel Patterson's case # 21 CF 1926 called and adjourned for a preliminary hearing.  While on the record in that case Atty. Kuhary was informed that the hearing set for 3/4/2022 would be cancelled and a preliminary hearing on this case would be set for the same date and time as 21 CF 1926.

Filed by Atty Roger Pyzyk to adjourn prelim due to his client going into inpatient treatment. Sent to CC Costello for review. Court's response: Unless objected to by DA's Office, change matter to status on prelim. but keeping the date and time as there is a victim/Marsy's Law issue. If no objections, Atty. Pyzyk can appear via Zoom to get new date.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 02/02/2022.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
Atty. Ronald Pyzyk.

Adjustment Number: 22A 003726,
Payable Number: 457092,
Receipt Number: 22R 004542,
Amount: $20.00
Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision, court raises it to a level 3.   CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  WCS and his treatment facility will have to coordinate reporting.  No contact with the individual that the defendant struck, or pending civil litigation.

01:24 PM Defendant Daniel T Patterson in court with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
